intro: Sarcotoechia protracta, commonly known as the protracta sarcotoechia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to certain regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its botanical features include hairy stems and capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Sarcotoechia protracta is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
